definition: to close a door
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
see 吃閉門羹|吃闭门羹[chi1 bi4 men2 geng1]
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to be refused entrance (idiom)/to find the door closed
shut oneself up and ponder over one's mistakes
airtight door
to close doors and block openings (idiom); mounting a strict defense
lit. lock the door and search for the right word (idiom); fig. the serious hard work of writing
to close the door in one's face (idiom)

sentences.english: D. Draw lines on the door frame according to the auxiliary rocker arm.
sentences.chinese: 按闭门器的副摇臂在门框上画线。

sentences.english: Being busily engaged in study, Professor Smith sported his door.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯教授忙于钻研学问，他闭门谢客。

sentences.english: After the hospital refused several times, Guan decided to sue it.
sentences.chinese: 在医院吃了几次闭门羹之后，管礼明决定向法院起诉。

sentences.english: Not behind closed doors, and so on with Initiative and Jiang Kui.
sentences.chinese: 闭门不出，与姜夔等相倡和。

sentences.english: Charles and I were closeted in his study for the briefing session.
sentences.chinese: 我和查尔斯在他的书房里闭门开简介会。

sentences.english: Mike's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 麦可要求调任时，他的老板赏了他闭门羹。

sentences.english: Every time I close the door on reality, it comes in through the window.
sentences.chinese: 我每次闭门不纳现实，它都从窗户进来。

sentences.english: The writer denied herself to visitors.
C. Match the main rocker arm with the door closer and screw down the screws.
sentences.chinese: 组合主摇臂和闭门器的主体并拧好螺丝。

sentences.english: However, he did not lock himself inside.
sentences.chinese: 但他没有因此而闭门不出。

sentences.english: Auto-close device should be installed in doors of BSL-2 labs.
sentences.chinese: 级实验室的门应加上闭门器。

sentences.english: Tom's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆要求调任时，他的老板让他吃了闭门羹。

sentences.english: The shop sported its oak today.
The 47 defendants appeared behind closed doors in a special security court in Manama.
sentences.chinese: 47名被告在麦纳麦特别安全法庭闭门受审。

sentences.english: The closed-door hearing, which lasted three hours, did not resolve the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 这次三个小时的闭门听证会并未解决问题。

sentences.english: She's invisible much of the time, bandaged or in seclusion.
sentences.chinese: 她在大多数时候深居简出，包在纱布里或闭门独处。

definition: to shut the door and remain inside/fig. to cut off contact
commune/private discussion
to decline to meet a visitor/to express one's gratitude to one's guests
to concentrate fully on sth/single-minded
to close the passes/to seal off the country/seclusion (monastic practice, e.g. of Chan Buddhists)
to lead a quiet and peaceful life in retirement/to stay home with nothing to do/to lead a solitary life
(Buddhism) to sit in contemplation
to sit silently
contemplation/meditation
study (room)
to reflect on one's past errors
to sit and pontificate; to find answers through theory and not through practice (idiom)
to think hard/bitter thoughts/to pour out one's sufferings
to have a discussion in a group/to have a chat with sb
to endure (years of suffering)
variant of 炳燭|炳烛[bing3 zhu2]
